title: Type mismatch in `for`'s pattern shows wrong type of iterator

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code ([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=5f0e3783d3fd771e9c586cb386bf5615)):

```rust
fn main() {
    let xs = Some(vec![(1, "abc")]);
    let (x, y) = &xs;
    for (x, y) in &xs {
        println!("{:?}", x);
    }
}
```

The current output is:

```rust
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:3:9
  |
3 |     let (x, y) = &xs;
  |         ^^^^^^   --- this expression has type `&Option<Vec<({integer}, &str)>>`
  |         |
  |         expected enum `Option`, found tuple
  |
  = note: expected enum `Option<Vec<({integer}, &str)>>`
            found tuple `(_, _)`

error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:4:9
  |
4 |     for (x, y) in &xs {
  |         ^^^^^^    --- this expression has type `&Vec<({integer}, &str)>`
  |         |
  |         expected struct `Vec`, found tuple
  |
  = note: expected struct `Vec<({integer}, &str)>`
              found tuple `(_, _)`
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
In both cases the expression underlined is `&xs`, but the second message shows a different type, the `<&Option<_> as IntoIterator>::Item`'s type, not `&xs`'.
